availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christian Thomsen Christensen (U.S. Army major and assistant adjutant general)

body.p: U.S. Army major and assistant adjutant general. Native of Denmark. Married to Emma L. Christensen. Father of Ophelia Christensen, Mathias Frederick Christensen, Dagmar Christensen, Waldemar F. Christensen, and Canby Christensen. Served in the 1st New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant and captain from April 24, 1861, to September 13, 1862. Served as major, lieutenant colonel, and assistant adjutant general of U.S. Volunteers from March 11, 1863, to May 11, 1864. Served as major and assistant adjutant general to the Military Division of West Mississippi from July 1864, to May 17, 1865. Breveted as colonel and brigadier general on March 13, 1865. Served as major and assistant adjutant general to the Department of the Gulf from May 17, 1865, to July 22, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, New York, Kings County, Brooklyn, District 224, p. 99B.
John H. Eicher & David J. Eicher, eds., Civil War High Commands (Stanford: Stanford University Press, 2001), 172.

Index to Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of New York, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M551, Roll 0024.
New York, Wills and Probate Records, 1659-1999, New York Supreme Court, Kings County Probate Administration Records, Elizabeth M Warner-Daniel E Homan, 1905, p. 109-110 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com on December 22, 2020).
